intro: Epidendroides tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, pendulous inflorescence and flowers that typically feature four stamens, giving it its scientific name. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
